Title: BLOB and TEXT Data Types
Description:
A BLOB is a binary large object that can hold a variable amount of
data. The four BLOB types are
These differ only in the maximum length of the values they can hold.

TINYTEXT,
TEXT,
MEDIUMTEXT, and
LONGTEXT.
JSON (alias for LONGTEXT)

These correspond to the four BLOB types and have the same
maximum lengths and storage requirements.
BLOB and TEXT columns can have a DEFAULT value.
MariaDB starting with 10.4.3From MariaDB 10.4, it is possible to set a unique index on columns that use the BLOB or TEXT data types.
